messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".performArithmeticOp(int, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryFoldAdd(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryFoldBinaryOperator(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryReduceOperandsForOp(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryFoldLeftChildOp(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryFoldArithmeticOp(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryConvertToNumber(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryFoldAssign(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".tryConvertOperandsToNumber(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)", ".optimizeSubtree(com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)"]

get_code_snippet
get_comments
messages.content: "\n   * Try to fold arithmetic binary operators\n   "

Title: Diagnosis of test `testFoldArithmetic`
Details: The test `testFoldArithmetic` in the class `com.google.javascript.jscomp.PeepholeFoldConstants` is failing. The test is checking the folding of arithmetic expressions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, etc. However, the error message indicates that there was an unexpected error related to a divide by zero operation. Looking at the code snippet for the `performArithmeticOp` method in `PeepholeFoldConstants`, we can see that the method tries to handle different arithmetic operations, including division. However, there is no specific check or exception handling for divide by zero situations. As a result, when the division operation is encountered and the denominator is zero, the method should throw an error and handle this specific case. This seems to be causing the failure in the test.

Suggested fix:
- `com.google.javascript.jscomp.PeepholeFoldConstants.performArithmeticOp(int, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)`

Please note that there may be other methods that need to be fixed as well.

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).

m13.content:
Title: Diagnosis of test `testFoldArithmetic`
Details: The test `testFoldArithmetic` in the class `com.google.javascript.jscomp.PeepholeFoldConstants` is failing. The test is checking the folding of arithmetic expressions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, etc. However, the error message indicates that there was an unexpected error related to a divide by zero operation. Looking at the code snippet for the `performArithmeticOp` method in `PeepholeFoldConstants`, we can see that the method tries to handle different arithmetic operations, including division. However, there is no specific check or exception handling for divide by zero situations. As a result, when the division operation is encountered and the denominator is zero, the method should throw an error and handle this specific case. This seems to be causing the failure in the test.

Suggested fix:
- `com.google.javascript.jscomp.PeepholeFoldConstants.performArithmeticOp(int, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node, com.google.javascript.rhino.Node)`

Please note that there may be other methods that need to be fixed as well.
